blog.name: wallofprompts
blog.title: The Wall of Prompts
blog.description: GoT prompts. Grab a prompt for a fic or left one. Main ships Jonerys and Gendrya, but everyone is welcome. Check the tags list for prompts.

summary: Margaery survives prompt
body:
Margaery survives prompt

In the chaos of the Great Sept, Margaery manages to hide herself and Loras in one of the Targaryen’s tombs. She survives but Loras is crushed below the debris and dies, alone and scared Margaery scapes King’s Landing. She wants to go home but she is afraid someone might recognize her before she will reach Highgarden and sell her to Cersei.

One night, while trying to find some scraps of food in the stables of an Inn, she hears the last news. The Targaryen Queen has made it to Dragonstone and in the North, the Starks have retaken Winterfell.

Now, Margaery has a plan.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: Sansa stans triggered that there was nothing about Sansa in that promo
Like how dare HBO miss out on THE main character around whom the show revolves
Stretching to connect things that are not related as usual...
summary: Sorry, but Jonsas arguing that the feather in the ‘aftermath’ promo represents Sansa is like the funniest thing ever.  Tyrion...
body:
Sorry, but Jonsas arguing that the feather in the ‘aftermath’ promo represents Sansa is like the funniest thing ever.

Tyrion gets the Hand of the Queen pin - signifying his story over 3 seasons, his position of power and how he used that power

Dany gets her dragon pin - the symbol of the house that she’s trying to restore for 7 seasons

Jon and Longlaw - this needs no explanation

Same with Arya and Needle

Jaime and Bran - the hand and the wheelchair - symbols of them being cripples that define them as characters and that defined their journeys

Sansa - the feather she placed on Lyanna’s statue that one time while chatting with LF…..

Are Jonsas really saying that the only relevant thing about Sansa as a character in 7 seasons was her keeping a feather on a statue 3 seasons ago? That’s the only important thing related to Sansa that HBO promo guys could think of? Not much of a main character then, is she?

Or maybe, just maybe, that feather is connected to the statue people keep placing it on? From the pilot when we were first introduced to Winterfell? Maybe it’s about R+L=J? About Ned and family and loyalty and love among the Starks? Just maybe? No?

Okay then.

Are Jonsas really saying that the only relevant thing about Sansa as a character in 7 seasons was her keeping a feather on a statue 3 seasons ago? That’s the only important thing related to Sansa that HBO promo guys could think of? Not much of a main character then, is she?

Or maybe, just maybe, that feather is connected to the statue people keep placing it on? From the pilot when we were first introduced to Winterfell? Maybe it’s about R+L=J? About Ned and family and loyalty and love among the Starks? Just maybe? No?

Okay then.

summary: "When someone is holding their hands behind their back and the hands are positioned in a palm in palm gesture, this not only...
body: • “When someone is holding their hands behind their back and the hands are positioned in a palm in palm gesture, this not only exposes the entire front of the person's body but is a display of fearlessness, superiority, as well as confidence in themselves” - Flow Psychology

summary: I stan (2) Stark legends … part 3
title: I stan (2) Stark legends … part 3
body:
The differences between Sansa and Tony Stark …


The first and biggest difference is the whole gender thing, duh. Sansa would have been treated completely differently if she’d been a boy, and Tony would have been treated completely differently if he’d been a girl. Kinda goes without saying.


This leads me to something they actually have in common: their attachments to villains. Sansa betrothed to Joffrey, married off to Ramsay, required to string Littlefinger along. Tony dating a Soviet spy back in the day (Black Widow yo!) and Madame Masque (who wasn’t evil at the time as I understand it). But I feel like this commonality is actually a glaring difference. Tony got in bed with bad guys ‘cause he gets in bed with everybody. Sansa did it because she didn’t have a choice. Man in modern times. Woman in medieval times. Tomato. Suspension bridge.


And perhaps the least important (but still very interesting) difference is that, let’s face it … Tony’s a Lannister. He’s got the color scheme. He’s got the swagger, the panache, the occasional overconfidence, the ~wine~. He didn’t just grow up well-to-do, he grew up ultra-rich. Neither of their dads met their emotional needs, but Howard was def more of a Tywin than a Ned. So I guess Tony is what we’d get if Sansa and Tyrion had a kid? idk


So thanks for attending my symposium. Please retire to the drawing room for lemon cakes and scotch.


edit: Forgot to add two things

Tony has a squad and they (sometimes) have his back. He’s always had Pepper, Rhodey and Happy, then he had the Avengers (i.e. the ones who don’t always have his back). Sansa has slowly amassed an unassailable squad over the course of seven seasons, but she spent much of her journey in isolation.


And Tony has a lot more to make up for from his past. Sansa was a little snooty and a little naïve. Tony was the merchant of death.


I’m really done this time :D

blog.name: hopelesstvaddict
blog.title: worry about the past. the future can wait.
blog.description:
No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

summary:
6x04 and the reunion scene is still so damn beautiful. So emotional. So rewarding. 
Also I never realized before but Jon says he...
body:
6x04 and the reunion scene is still so damn beautiful. So emotional. So rewarding.

Also I never realized before but Jon says he was alone while the rest of them played - including Sansa. So this idea that she was isolating herself from her siblings is not completely true. She did at some point participate in the games they played as I imagined she would.

reblog.comment:
6x04 and the reunion scene is still so damn beautiful. So emotional. So rewarding.

Also I never realized before but Jon says he was alone while the rest of them played - including Sansa. So this idea that she was isolating herself from her siblings is not completely true. She did at some point participate in the games they played as I imagined she would.

trail.content_raw:
6x04 and the reunion scene is still so damn beautiful. So emotional. So rewarding.

Also I never realized before but Jon says he was alone while the rest of them played - including Sansa. So this idea that she was isolating herself from her siblings is not completely true. She did at some point participate in the games they played as I imagined she would.
trail.content:
6x04 and the reunion scene is still so damn beautiful. So emotional. So rewarding.

Also I never realized before but Jon says he was alone while the rest of them played - including Sansa. So this idea that she was isolating herself from her siblings is not completely true. She did at some point participate in the games they played as I imagined she would.

summary: Cersei took Robert’s Advice to Heart
title: Cersei took Robert’s Advice to Heart
body:
Warning, this post deals with possible leaks in part of the speculation for this meta.

In season one, we see Cersei really pay attention to Robert and Joffrey when they talk about their military plans. In fact, Cersei is the only character who took Robert seriously when it came to Daenerys.

What did Robert say?

Stop Daenerys. Don’t meet the Dothraki in an open field. Have one army.

The one army bit was something Joffrey also believed in, and Cersei seemed to like it because it centralized power.

The show itself proved that Robert was right.

Daenerys did come to Westeros.

Meeting the Dothraki in an open field was the wrong decision.

Not having control of the Seven Kingdoms in one army meant Cersei could not help to defeat Daenerys’s army.

But Cersei isn’t wallowing in a tower over her proof strategy. We have to remember she only recently came into power, and her previous control was hampered by others.

Upon ascending the throne she has developed a weapon which could kill a dragon.

She bought an army with experience fighting the Dothraki in an open field.

And the third bit of advice about one army?

I think that is where the Sansa kidnapping plot could be coming into play. We know that Cersei spoke with Tyrion and they may be working together. Given the possible leak that Tyrion is executed for betrayal, I have a theory about what may happen:

Cersei is going to kidnap Sansa to coerce Jon into betraying Daenerys. She wants to unite the Westerosi armies against the threat that Daenerys poses.

I don’t think she will ultimately succeed in the way she plans, especially since she is also unaware Jon is a contender to the throne, but I do think it will set into motion a series of events that will change the course of the war.

Cersei will make a brilliant tactical decision, but ultimately be undone by Lyanna’s ghost. What harm could she do to Cersei now? A lot, as it turns out.

I don’t think she will ultimately succeed in the way she plans, especially since she is also unaware Jon is a contender to the throne, but I do think it will set into motion a series of events that will change the course of the war.

Cersei will make a brilliant tactical decision, but ultimately be undone by Lyanna’s ghost. What harm could she do to Cersei now? A lot, as it turns out.
trail.content:
Warning, this post deals with possible leaks in part of the speculation for this meta.

In season one, we see Cersei really pay attention to Robert and Joffrey when they talk about their military plans. In fact, Cersei is the only character who took Robert seriously when it came to Daenerys.

What did Robert say?

Stop Daenerys. Don’t meet the Dothraki in an open field. Have one army.

The one army bit was something Joffrey also believed in, and Cersei seemed to like it because it centralized power.

The show itself proved that Robert was right.

Daenerys did come to Westeros.

Meeting the Dothraki in an open field was the wrong decision.

Not having control of the Seven Kingdoms in one army meant Cersei could not help to defeat Daenerys’s army.

But Cersei isn’t wallowing in a tower over her proof strategy. We have to remember she only recently came into power, and her previous control was hampered by others.

Upon ascending the throne she has developed a weapon which could kill a dragon.

She bought an army with experience fighting the Dothraki in an open field.

And the third bit of advice about one army?

I think that is where the Sansa kidnapping plot could be coming into play. We know that Cersei spoke with Tyrion and they may be working together. Given the possible leak that Tyrion is executed for betrayal, I have a theory about what may happen:

Cersei is going to kidnap Sansa to coerce Jon into betraying Daenerys. She wants to unite the Westerosi armies against the threat that Daenerys poses.

I don’t think she will ultimately succeed in the way she plans, especially since she is also unaware Jon is a contender to the throne, but I do think it will set into motion a series of events that will change the course of the war.

Cersei will make a brilliant tactical decision, but ultimately be undone by Lyanna’s ghost. What harm could she do to Cersei now? A lot, as it turns out.

blog.name: lady-griffin
blog.title: LadyGriffin's Home
blog.description: A bad idea written down is far better and far more useful to you than a blank sheet of paper and a mythical piece of brilliance that has been stuck in your head out of fear of failure. Go ahead and fail. Then make it better.

summary: Speculation:
body:
Speculation:

So I was already thinking about this before we saw Sana’s newest dress, but now I’m really thinking about it.


What if, Sansa is dressing to emulate Daenerys.


Hear me out.


Sansa dressing and styling herself like the people (other women) she admires and wants to be associated with (as well as who’s she learned from) is a well recognized trait by both the audience and other characters in the actual show.

So wouldn’t that be a good way to make not just the other characters, but the audience as well, assume that Sansa is now Team Dany. Whether or not she actually is.

I rather like that idea, personally. Or perhaps I’m overthinking everything, but I can see Sansa doing that.

summary: So, I assumed Sansa’s “Tully inspired” dress was her armour dress that Sophie talked about but clearly, after seeing today’s...
body:
Sansa’s Armour & Dresses

So, I assumed Sansa’s “Tully inspired” dress was her armour dress that Sophie talked about but clearly, after seeing today’s photos it’s not.

I wonder when, where and why she wears the “scaly” dress?!

What are your thoughts?
